Review.Titre: Software does not work, website does not load
Review.Contenu: None of the links on the website worked. I thought it was because I use Mozilla Firefox. None of the videos on using the product with Firefox were accurate or helpful. I paid $19 and there is no company contact information, no ability to chat with tech support, and no ability to request a refund. I found a way to cancel my auto-renewal after 3 hours of searching, trying the app on my phone (those instructions did not work either) and browser.

Review.Titre: Ghost Support and Spam Spectacular: A Tale of Customer Neglect
Review.Contenu: Beware: Customer support for this product might as well be a ghost story. Tried to renew my subscription for 1 year because of that 'amazing' deal they've pitched 10 times in my inbox? Can't change subscription type. Dead end. Web site, support, horror.The website is a maze with no exit, and customer service is an echo chamber. Prepare for zero assistance and an onslaught of spam. The product shines, but the neglect is simply shameful.And to Daniel who is behind "noreply" at totaladblock.com, who's so keen on filling my inbox with futile reminders to renew—congratulations, you've been promoted to my mail-rule "Adblock": straight to the bin. Keep the offers coming; they make excellent digital confetti.

Review.Titre: Grifted by Total Adblock
Review.Contenu: Grifted by Total Adblock. Charged subscription to Apple Card. Subscription never showed up on my Apple Card so I could not cancel it following all  directions on their site on how to do so. Somehow Total Adblock was able to charge the account (debit card/checking) with which I pay my Apple Card. Clicked on chat box on their site and it kicked me back to overall menu for the site. Basically they make it impossible to cancel the account (I saw that this happened to another reviewer). I had to have my bank stop and block further charges. On top of it all the app was ineffective in blocking ads - they still popped up - it only blocked me from getting to the advertiser if I clicked on the pop-up.

Review.Titre: I got total ad block installed
Review.Contenu: I got total ad block installed. It showed up as an extension in my Chrome browser. I did not like it and tried to remove it. Although it seems like removal was successful... It continued to add an advertisement page to Chrome. This "totaladblock.com" advertisement page tab will not go away. It does not even show up under saved pages or tabs in the browser. The sneaky people hid it. Now I have to completely reset my browser to get rid of it.

Review.Titre: This is a scam
Review.Contenu: I mistakenly got caught up in an ongoing subscription, which they won’t let me cancel. I’ve attempted to cancel via their dashboard page where they claim to have “dispatched a verification code to the email address associated with your account”, which THEY DON’T DO. So I’m stuck paying $10 per month for something that doesn’t work and I don’t want and, like other users, am resorted to cancelling a bank account in order to stop this.

Review.Titre: SCAM ALERT DAYLIGHT ROBBERY
Review.Contenu: I subscribed to this thinking it would block adverts. This didn't happen, and I tried to cancel my subscription on the Google Play store, but it wasn't on Google Play for me to cancel. I couldn't cancel my subscription on their website, and there is no contact information to contact their customer services. They are SCAM RED FLAG. Do not fall for their robbing tricks—thieves in disguise. I had to contact my bank to cancel further payments from them and then get help from the fraud team through my bank.

Review.Titre: Total Disgrace - Total Scam
Review.Contenu: Making cancelling literally impossible is a total disgrace. Total Scam would be a better name. I would leave a minus rating if I could. When something is this complicated to cancel, it usually tells you that its useless, and you wont be getting any kind of support with it. Should be illegal to do this.The reply you offer is rubbish. I tried those options many times and they conveniently don't work, strange that. Don't try to suggest it's easy to cancel when you have deliberately made sure it isn't. Response just proves the intent to mislead people. Borderline scam.

Review.Titre: Unpleasant Experience
Review.Contenu: My interaction with TotalAddBlock has been a complete disaster. They charged me more than agreed upon and made canceling impossible. The lack of transparency and unresponsive customer service make them a company to avoid. Save yourself the trouble and choose a more reliable service.

Review.Titre: Absolutely awful company
Review.Contenu: Absolutely awful company. I have tried to cancel more times than I can remember.Complete and utter scam!Never install this app. Before you know it they are taking Money out of your bank on a monthly basis!I will be taking this further.

Review.Titre: This is a total scam
Review.Contenu: This is a total scam! I have tried for two months to cancel with no success. I have now instructed my legal team to take it up a level. Maybe the threat of a court case will encourage them to read and answer their emails.Total Disgrace is the name they should be known by.I truly hope that people reading this review will think twice before signing up to lose their money.

Review.Titre: They will not cancel payments and will…
Review.Contenu: They will not cancel payments and will keep taking money from your account. Even if you change your card. They will not comply with your wishes

Review.Titre: Untrustworthy
Review.Contenu: Don't get this, bunch of thieves tried taking payment despite fact I cancelled the subscription! Any company that does this cannot be trusted with personal details. Will be reporting for fraudulent activitiesUPDATE: They contacted me & I have twice since told them I don't want their app & to cancel it, like they were meant to weeks ago, yet they still haven't & still trying to convince me I want it. I EFFING DON'T, WHY DON'T THEY LISTEN! CROOKSUPDATE 2: They still haven't cancelled, trying to tell me I really want it & offering free stuff, (which they'll charge for next month probably), they don't understand what I don't want your app means obviously! And just to rub it in I get another billing mail telling me my account is suspended due to non payment 🤬 yes, correct, & it will never be paid because I used PayPal & cancelled the authorisation with them. So TotalBrainblock take the hint yeah!UPDATE 3: Now, as expected they ignore all mails despite receiving them. As myself & many others have pointed out these thieves will not cancel your subscription but lie to try to get your payment set up again. Have reported them to the authorities for attempted theft & fraud

Review.Titre: It works fine on the pc but i have not…
Review.Contenu: It works fine on the pc but i have not been able to get it past the orange power icon the app where it says enable now. Installed and unistalled a couple of times following the website video and it has not worked. I am glad that i only paid for one month. Waste of money.

Review.Titre: SCAM, Avoid at all costs!
Review.Contenu: Total Adblock renewed without the promised 30-day warning email. On their first try, our bank rejected their charge as fraud. On their second try, it slipped through, so we were charged $119. It has been impossible to get that money refunded because they provide dead contact links, you cannot reach a human, and their instructions for cancellation lead nowhere. This is a complete racket, and it should be illegal. I notice that all of the positive reviews are invited ones. That's suspicious.UPDATE: Total Adblock has refunded our money. I used the billing address on my original confirming email. However, I still would not recommend this company due to their shady billing practices and dead contact links.

Review.Titre: It's a TOTAL AD-CHEAT
Review.Contenu: Beware- it's a Total Ad-cheat rather than Total Ad-block. It does not do what it says it does. It never worked for me, apparently (as they told me on a phone call) it works only on Safari, but not on other platforms so totally pointless if you expect the ads to disappear from google, or you-tube or anything else. And once paid for, you are tied in for a year, being charged fees you never agreed to, impossible to find out whom to contact or how to get a refund. Stay away from this deceptive ripp-off app which is nothing more but a total con.

Review.Titre: This DOES NOT block ALL ANNOYING ADS
Review.Contenu: This DOES NOT block ALL ANNOYING ADS! It also does not stop websites from tracking where you go! I bought it and the ads are worse now than before! I would not buy this product(?)!

Review.Titre: Do not download this one, you won't be able to cancel it easy
Review.Contenu: When i bought it,I did not know that it is not a one time, but  a monthly fee with automatical subsctription, so they will take each month money from me automaticly... in theyr page they say you can get refund -lie.  It was too difficult to install, I could not make it work... i wrote for customer support asking how to cancel it and for the refund, but they did not tell me how to cancel! I asked 5 times directly that i want to cancel subsctription and they litterally refuse to answer completelly  ignoring my question. Like i am speaking in different language or something. I am pretty sure they were instructed to ignore this question and do not let people to stop substription. Finally I spend one hour untill i found on my own how to cancel this, i hope i did... nothing about this is okey.

Review.Titre: TOTAL AD Block sharp practise …
Review.Contenu: Signed up with Total Ad block for 19 Euro ,but never used it ,One year later Total Ad Block tried to take 119 Euro out of my account ,without any notice to me Bank informed me and blocked it, Took 5 e-mails to try and sort out this ,with the same replies from the company, First they claim they sent notification ,which never happened I also checked spam messages. Very sharp practise as usually most companies notify you about charges. Be careful what you sign up to

Review.Titre: Charges

Review.Contenu: I signed up for $1.99 monthly, but it is impossible. I.must agree to an annual purchase. This is a bait and switch. How sad.

Review.Titre: RIP OFF
Review.Contenu: RIP OFF.   Subscription jumped from £19 to £119 without any notice whatsoever.  I cancelled any future subscription and raised a case with Paypal.Then I get a noreply email from Adblock saying I cancelled.   Signed Sandra.  NO REPLY  and no contact details on their website.  AVOIDUpdate.  For the record.  I did not receive any email 30 days prior to this renewal amount that is well hidden in the Ts & Cs   But thanks to Paypal.  I have now had a total refund.

Review.Contenu: While I like AdBlock, when it works, I keep getting told my subscription has expired and it shuts off the software.  The expiration date, based on my payments on their website, is October 2024, so why are they shutting it down, repeatedly in 2023.  OKAY, so I'll contact them and see what can be done.  THERE IS NOWHERE TO CONTACT THEM.  Their support pages only let you pick topics of their choice and anything else, oh well!

Review.Titre: False hopes
Review.Contenu: Never wrote a review before now but here we go. Gives you the wrong subscription and support cancels chat each time, then stops responding when you try to request a refund. Do not buy.

Review.Titre: Um, no. Down from 5 stars to one as they kept billing me so the bank had to deactivate card.
Review.Contenu: Just installed. Hoping for the best. So far so good.UPDATE SAME DAYWhile it seems to be working ok, I got double billed for the more expensive version and it took over 90 minutes on a BOT chat to (I'm hoping) get it resolved.Rather than refund the double billed unwanted service, they kept trying to bargain with me.It does seem to be working as advertised, but this isn't off to a confidence inspiring start.I'll be fair and leave the 5 star rating for now, but if any issues arise I'll be back with update!Also, keep an eye on the expiry date because the way they ask you to format the date is odd.UPDATE 12/20/23 Down to one star. I realize this, cancel the subscription through their support, or so I am told, and that I will receive a refund.  A week or two passes, no cancellation, no refund, and now I am magically outside of the window where they will allow me to refund my subscription.  Again, which I never knew i signed up for or authorized.  And their support is extremely slow to respond and work with.  0 stars.  Stay away.

Review.Titre: Total Adblock was a horrible…
Review.Contenu: Total Adblock was a horrible experience! It took over my browser and actually resulted in more ads, not fewer. And very tough to get rid of. Ugh. Good Riddance to bad company.

Review.Titre: Total Ad Block? Total Scam is more like it
Review.Contenu: I tried to order Total Ad Block. Before I realized I was being upsold on additional software, I had inadvertently bought 3 things, only 1 of which I wanted. Then I was unable to download and install Total Ad Block. I contacted customer service (chat was the only option) and the agent confirmed I had not installed any of the 3 programs. I asked to cancel and be refunded. In fact I asked at least a dozen times. The agent would only send me a link for downloading help. By this point I no longer wanted the software because my experience on their website totally killed any confidence I might have had, at every step, they tried to upsell me without taking me directly to what I had requested, and clicking on Install or Download never worked, the help button just took me back to the same useless "dashboard." CS agent ended the chat when I kept asking for cancellation and a refund. This was less than 24 hours after the original purchase. I had given up on it last night and started over tonight when I got an email saying I hadn't finished setting up my account (which hadn't worked properly last night). Totally buggy website, why would I trust their software now?

Review.Titre: total adblocker ads
Review.Contenu: the only reason I need total adblocker is to block their ads!!  I get a constant assault of ads for total adblocker to the point of being ABUSIVE.

Review.Titre: FIND AN EASIER APP WITH BETTER SUPPORT
Review.Contenu: Install is badly designed. Customer Service nonexistent. I fought with online chat (Susie) to get a refund for ten minutes and she hung up, so I invested the ONE HOUR and 20 MINUTES to decipher how to get it loaded despite them having given me exe files (no good w Android) FIND AN EASIER APP WITH BETTER SUPPORT. Paid for more stuff I probably did not get, like multiple devices.

Android phone. So of coarse I am not going to put a harmful app on my phone. I tried to creat an account to request my money back but they won’t let me. Update, they refunded my money. Very quickly and they were professional about it. Still they need a better way to get ahold of them besides writing bad reviews.

Review.Contenu: Yes ads suck. But apps that don't upload and work properly even worse. Good luck with customer support as far as I can it doesn't exist.

Review.Titre: They make it almost impossible to cancel and…
Review.Contenu: They make it impossible to cancel, and there appears to be zero customer support. I paid an introductory price, but the app told me I was on a free account. Due to that, there was no billing account to allow me to cancel. I've spent a couple of hours in a loop and have sent multiple emails, but still no further forward. I wish I'd never gone near it. Update: Almost impossible to cancel. It took several emails and perserverance, but I have a confirmation email saying it's cancelled. I'll watch and wait.

Review.Titre: Total Rubbish
Review.Contenu: I paid for Total Adblock, it is rubbish. I still have ads on everything I look at on internet. It gives link to use to block ads on individual videos, you follow link, it doesn't block ads.I wish I hadn't spent nearly £30 on such rubbish.I will never purchase this again and will never recommend this to anyone.Complete waste of money.UPDATE: I received a very long reply from Adblock giving instructions on how to 'properly' install the app. I had already done all the suggestions they gave but did it again just incase. After now installing everything and activating and allowing everything as told by them in their reply to my review Total Adblock DOES NOT block ads on any app, server, website, game, that I go on.My otiginal review still stands ADBLOCK IS RUBBISH.

Review.Titre: Poor service :
Review.Contenu: Poor service :Purchased Total Adblock and was not happy. I called and was told I could cancel and be refunded. Early November I received a letter confirming refund would arrive in 48 hrs but could take up to 7 days. Nov. 21 I called to advise I haven't received refund - they confirmed it hadn't been sent but they would send it right away. I received same letter of confirmation. Nov. 30th still not received I called again and was told that it had been sent and the problem was with my bank. Luckily it's only $ 23.80 because I assume I will never see it. I would call that close to fraud.

Review.Titre: Customer services abysmal
Review.Contenu: On checking my PayPal account I noticed payments going to total adblock at £9.95 a month and not knowing what this was for searched my phone for an app but found nothing so checked my emails but again found nothing so made contact with the company. Initially their response was they couldn't find an account in my name and sent a list of questions to assist their search which was duly supplied.They came back to me citing a little used email address (my eBay email) and to log into my account if I wished to cancel. Not a lot of use if you didn't set it up.Logged onto the web site and it was trying to sell the product to me. Why if I already have an account!?So back to customer services whose next helpful response was they had sent a link to my account that would allow me to log in - but you had to log in to view it¡!!!I finally got the account cancelled and one month payment refunded because that is what I had agreed to - and that is the whole point I didn't sign upGetting nowhere fast so picked up the phone and rang customer services and got a young lady who seemed totally unconcerned about my complaint. through out the call she talked at ten to the dozen not taking time to listen to me and when I tried to talk shouted me downSo I have stopped the payments and got last month's refunded but no right of appeal for the four previous months. Total adblock I don't know how good your product is because I have never used it but you customer service is abysmal

Review.Contenu: Took £119 from my account for renewal without my permission..no way to cancel or contact customer services..In reply, yes I did get an email to say the price was jumping from £29 to £119..I then took the link to cancel which I duly did..but then £119 was taken from my account...there is no Telephone number to contact Total Ad Block and no email...Why???? because they don't want you to contact them once they have your bank details...they say Transparent and valuable..yes transparent..they rob you in plain sight.. valuable???how can it be valuable when I eventually managed to cancel next years renewal of £119, within seconds, yes seconds the price offered was reduced £90..yes you read correct £90..Total SkulduggeryTotal crooksTotal SkulduggeryI await an apology and reimbursementKind regards

Review.Contenu: We are very disappointed in Total Adblock, as we had several billing issues. Our original package was for $1,99 per month. The first month, we were billed with the correct amount that we signed up for. Ads were blocked and we were very satisfied, until we were billed incorrectly each month after the first month. We  then were charged $9,99 every month since the second month of our subscription. This is totally unacceptable, therefor, we unfortunately had to cancel our subscription. Such a shame, as Total Adblock is losing customers due to incorrect billing after agreeing and signing up on a certain subscription package!!

Review.Titre: allows notifications and then tries to sell
Review.Contenu: This "adblock" by default sets permissions for Notifications for a bunch of websites like hulu, facebook, instagram... you name it. You can not remove these permissions manually, but behold there is a solution: Pay for their premium package, which blocks unwanted notifications, which wouldn't even exist if they didn't allow them in the beginning.Pro tip: uninstall this browser extension, you browser already knows how to block notifications you did not manually allow!Edit: I am not talking about popups but Browser notifications, and there was no option in the browser settings to turn them off. They were set by your browser extension.

Review.Titre: Con men
Review.Contenu: These thieves presented my card without my permission and debited me with $119!When I asked them to reverse it,they offered me a fifty percent discount!It still does not work!

Review.Titre: SCAM SCAM SCAM
Review.Contenu: SCAM SCAM SCAMIn response to Total Adblock - there is a fake Total Adblock. There is no way to contact them. The "links" to the customer care do not work. Nothing works. It is not the legitimate Total Adblock.The website looks sooooo legitimate. All this  one is  is  a way to strip money from your credit card.

Review.Titre: Shocking Charges and Customer Service
Review.Contenu: Shocking!! Like a number of other comments on here I subscribed for £1.99 per month. I then was charged £ 9.99 after the initial month. Unsubscribing seemed just about impossible so I had to ask my bank to bloock any future charges. Definitely would NOT recommend this software.

Review.Titre: Difficult to leave
Review.Contenu: I paid £9.95 a month without any warning, cancelled my account, and payment to my credit card continued. After an hour on a chat system they say they have identified a duplicate account, which they have no explanation for and will cancel my account again. It is an agonisingly obtuse process to get out of having an account and I am not yet convinced that it has yet happened.  Their website gives no indication of how to do this- they have deliberately made it as difficult as possible- and I AM computer literate!

Review.Titre: CRIMINAL COMPANY
Review.Contenu: Anyone who is writing a good review for this company is either a bot or has some affiliation with the company. These people are CRIMINALS. DO NOT BUY THIS SERVICE.The same day I bought it is the same day I sent TWO emails to the support addresses displayed on their website. These emails were ignored and I forgot about the whole thing, until I was charged again the following month. After days of trying to find the option to cancel, I discovered that there is no option to cancel on the website and when you stop auto-renewal, they inundate you with discounts and more offers to rejoin. Offers that are so pathetic and low, it just proves how worthless the service is.Eventually I managed to find their primitive live chat service, which puts you in touch with a person with a fake name that speaks broken English and spends half the time trying to offer you more ad-ons and discounts instead of acknowledging that all you want is a cancellation and a refund. In the end, the person stated I was ineligible for a refund on the first month because I didn’t cancel in time. Federal laws regarding such blatant illegalities are now in the purview of the proper legal minds!This is not the end of this little brainless caper - but only the beginning!

Review.Contenu: I purchased a year of TotalAV for 69.95 after reading reviews. (The complaint was too many ads, but thought it would be so much less than it was.) Also given a free trial of Adblock. When the time to buy, did not Adblock chose not to renew, and for several days each time I refreshed the screen or opened a new tab or site,  would get the ad to order. Within the month, I wrote to cancel; they promised me free things which made me feel uncomfortable making me realize the price should be lower, and after a time was sent to a site to cancel. After canceling, informed the refund would be $19.00! Get this product if you want continual ads harassing you as it did to me, and then, if not satisfied, find a refund so little you will not be happy..Just received a notification if I didn't respond to their reply, the review would be removed. If you read my review and their response, it is as if they are not listening. I was charged $69 and change, for a year, canceled before the first month was up and the refund was 19.00 and change. Go figure that out.

Most importantly READ EVERYTHING BEFORE PAYING. There is NO free either, you get a trial and you need to insure to cancel at least 3 days before billing is supposed to begin or you get charged. I’VE USED BETTER ADD BLOCKERSThis is what it said in its entiretyMake sure to read the last sentence!!!!!’In the pop up its light grey.“ Block Annoying Ads For Free!Instantly take control of your browsing experience by blocking annoying & intrusive ads across all of your favorite websites at home and on-the-go.Block Ads For FreeFree for 7-days then $7.99/month after”——- response to AnnaI never paid, I read everything and chose NOT to begin free trial. Review.Titre: Hard sale techniques
Review.Contenu: I signed up for Total Adblock in order to block unwanted adverts while on YouTube. However, the service was incredibly limited IMO unless I used it on my desktop computer.My main concern is the hard sale techniques they used when I tried to cancel the auto-renewal. There was no option to manage my subscription. It took four emails to their replies that encouraged me to continue using the service before finally being sent a link to cancel. Additionally, I had agreed to pay £35 for the year. However, the following text was buried in the notification stating renewal is £119 for the year.“As a reminder, your Total Adblock annual service is set to renew on 19th of January for £119.00 unless cancelled. If you would like to keep your service active, no further action is required.”Total Adblock has since confirmed this information is readily available on their website.Of course the final email from them began to offer a reduced rate of £35 to keep my business. I felt that accepting this offer would lead to the whole auto renewal saga next year, so I declined by cancelling. Personally, I would never subscribe to this service again! I’d rather die in the sand!

Review.Titre: Renewal is an unnecessary a time waster
Review.Contenu: Today I renewed my expired Adblock installation.1. I was unable to log in to the Adblock website with my existing account using my established email and password because there was no clear path to do this. I had to re-establish that same account and password to renew2. I had to start at the beginning to renew my subscription which involved unnecessary work and cost me time3. When I reestablished my ID it would not accept my pasted name and address. What a pain! Had to type the whole thing by hand. More wasted time.4. When  I tried to paste my 16 digit credit card number it would not accept pasting. Another waste of my time.Most web sites allow pasting of the card no but require only manually entered expiration dates and the CVV. What a waste of time to copy the 16 numbers manually to your web site from a file on my machine or to try to read them from the new type of card with the nearly illegible numbers! Made me so mad I almost cancelled the renewalEach one of those 4 time-wasting impediments to a quick renewal should have cost you one star each, but I was generous and gave you two stars.My renewal of Adblocker was such a wretched experience that I would not have tolerated if Adblocker were not so good and reliable.
